Posts.Content: luckygirl1 wrote: my markers went from 500 to 1800.  500 was on the ca15-3 test and the 1800 just recently taken was at the hospital and the doctor said it was a different test but similar.  my liver has more tumors now and I am going to start on a new chemo next week (inxempra).  I am allergic to alot of chemos and alot of them don't work.  the only other chemo that really worked for me was abraxane.  has anyone had abraxane work for them and did inxempra and it worked for them also.  also have bone mets and brain mets.  anyone had cryosurgery done.  they take rods and insert them in your tumors and freeze the tumors.  I live in st. louis missouri.  please state where you live if you don't mind and where you are getting treated.  I am getting treated at St. Anthony's hospital in St. Louis Missouri.  Dr. Morris. Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 08:06AM luckygirl1 wrote: Hi, just trying to get involved. Just wanted to gather your thoughts.  If you are like me, been fighting this metastic breast cancer since July 2011.  I am on my second chemo try.  Getting concerned.  I live in St. Louis Missouri and get treate at St. Anthony's medical center.  I am happy there but I called CTCA and they said they can do treatments on you that other places can't because they get FDA approval for an individual patient.  Anyone out there getting concerned and wanting to maybe go for a second opinion.  My insurance is good there in Zion, Illinois and they said they have the best doctors they work with in Illinois.  They pick you up in a Lemozine and put you up in a hotel for 3 to 5 days while you are evaluated and they pay for all your food.  What do you think?
